title: Pregnant MAFS star Cyrell Paule shows off her growing bump in a bikini
text:
She is expected to welcome her first child in February.

And Cyrell Paule was bumping along nicely on Tuesday as she enjoyed a relaxed beach date with her boyfriend Eden Dally in Sydney.

The Married At First Sight star, 30, showcased her growing tummy in a striped bikini and a pair of skimpy denim shorts.

Baby on board! Pregnant MAFS star Cyrell Paule was bumping along nicely on Tuesday as she enjoyed a relaxed beach date with her boyfriend Eden Dally in Sydney

Cyrell, who unzipped her shorts to accommodate her bump, accessorised with dark sunglasses and white sneakers.

Meanwhile, Eden looked every inch the doting father-to-be as he held hands with his pregnant girlfriend.

The former Love Island star, 27, flaunted his muscular frame in a tight black T-shirt and nautical print boardshorts.

Beach chic: Cyrell showcased her growing tummy in a striped bikini and a pair of denim shorts

Get a room! The loved-up couple were seen kissing during their date

Doing it for the 'gram! Later on, Eden snapped selfies of the pair on the beach

He completed his beachside look with a pair of slides, a baseball cap and shades.

The loved-up couple were seen kissing during their date, before relaxing on a beach towel and snapping selfies.

At one stage, Eden protectively touched Cyrell's baby bump as she smiled.

Tender moment: At one stage, Eden protectively touched Cyrell's baby bump as she smiled

Sweet: Eden looked every inch the doting father-to-be as he cradled his girlfriend's stomach

Baby Cyclone coming soon! Cyrell unzipped her shorts to accommodate her growing bump

Cyrell first announced her pregnancy in August, telling New Idea the news came as a surprise as she and Eden weren't planning a baby.

At the time, the couple expressed concerns that some people would dismiss their child as a 'publicity stunt'.

Cyrell said the negativity had been 'sad' and 'exhausting', adding: 'I wouldn't be surprised if my child is going to get called a publicity stunt.'

Surprise! Cyrell first announced her pregnancy in August, telling New Idea the news came as a surprise as she and Eden weren't planning a baby

Negativity: At the time, the couple expressed concerns that some people would dismiss their baby as a 'publicity stunt'

Concerns: 'I wouldn't be surprised if my child is going to be called a publicity stunt,' said Cyrell

Eden echoed similar sentiments, saying: 'I guarantee people will say the baby is a publicity stunt.

'They'll say we got pregnant to stay relevant or to extend our 15 minutes of fame.'

The couple are yet to announce the gender of their child, but have confirmed the due date is February 2020.

Save the date! The couple are yet to announce the gender of their child, but have confirmed the due date is February 2020
description: Cyrell Paule was bumping along nicely on Tuesday as she enjoyed a relaxed beach date with her boyfriend Eden Dally in Sydney
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
